author: shamatar
content: I think it should be possible to use Dory - log time verifiable transparent poly commit over pairing friendly curves. It should be aggregatable down to single pairing check at the end of the day, so verification speed will not suffer too much

author: shamatar
content: Or bulletproof based one, that will have linear verification, but also aggregatable, so it’s linear over the number of elements per node of the tree

author: shamatar
content: As for the structure of the trusted setup it’s good to use the same one, so you can always aggregate a final pairing in different kzg commitment openings
